DOC.brief_summary: Nitazoxanide has proved an cytoprotective effect against rotavirus infection. How it could be clinically important in time of hospitalization and reduction of duration of diarrhea secondary to rotavirus?
DOC.brief_title: Use of Nitazoxanide and Probiotics in Acute Diarrhea Secondary to Rotavirus
DOC.detailed_description: Nitazoxanide has demonstrated a cytoprotective effect against rotavirus, reducing duration time of diarrhea in comparison to placebo in previous studies. In the current study, based in those results, we design a randomized single-blind controlled trial, in order to asses the effectiveness of nitazoxanide and probiotics in comparison with a control group
DOC.criteria: Positive stool sample for rotavirus test Severe malnourishment Severe dehydration History of diarrhea more than 3 days previous hospitalization Use of antibiotics, probiotics or nitazoxanide 3 weeks before admission Systemic infections Severe chronic disease Mixed enteric infections besides rotavirus
